title: Des Connolly
text:
Des Connolly was a <a href="Gaelic%20football">football</a>er from <a href="County%20Laois">County Laois</a>.
Connolly was a native of Ballyfoyle in the <a href="Ballylinan">Ballylinan</a> parish but played all his club football with the <a href="Carlow">Carlow</a> border club, <a href="Graiguecullen">Graiguecullen</a>.
Considered to be one of Laois's greatest ever players, he was however only a substitute when the county won the <a href="Leinster%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">Leinster Senior Football Championship</a> final against Kildare in 1946.
Laois didn't win the <a href="Leinster%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">Leinster Senior Football Championship</a> again until 2003 when <a href="Mick%20O%27Dwyer">Mick O'Dwyer</a> led them to victory.
